alert.note: Alert for Butler; Montgomery; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 6:22AM EDT until May 07 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in Southwest Ohio, Butler and Warren. In West Central Ohio, Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Kettering, Middletown, Miamisburg, Springboro, Monroe, Trenton, Franklin, Bellbrook, Moraine, Carlisle, South Middletown, West Carrollton, Hunter, Germantown, Farmersville, Centerville, Poast Town Heights, Five Points, Pekin and State Route 48 at State Route 73.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
